title: Gratin of Four Onions
ingredients: 1 large yellow onion, halved lengthwise and sliced thin
2 bunches of leeks, dark green top cut off and discarded, halved lengthwise, washed well, and
A 1-pound bag frozen small white onions
¼ cup minced fresh parsley leaves
instructions: In a large skillet cook the shallots, the yellow onion, the leeks, and the garlic in the butter over moderately low heat, stirring, until the onions are softened.  Add the small white onions, and cook the mixture, stirring, until the small white onions are just tender.  Stir in the cream, bring the liquid to a boil, and simmer the mixture until the cream is thickened.  Season the mixture with salt and pepper and stir in the parsley.  The dish may be prepared up to this point several hours in advance and kept covered loosely.

Spoon the onion mixture into a buttered 1½- to 2-quart shallow baking dish, sprinkle the crumbs lightly over the top, and bake the mixture in a preheated 475° F. oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cream is bubbling around the edges and the crumbs are golden.
Source:  Gourmet Menus:  A Victorian Thanksgiving, Gourmet Magazine, November 1984.
